extDescription.message: An easy-to-use blog editor lets you post to all of your blogs.

firsttime_text.message: The first thing you're probably going to want to do is add your blog.  Close this dialog and click 'Add a New Blog' to get started.

text_get_started.message: Click "Add a New Blog" to get started.

entry_new_label.description: The label that appears in the entries list to designate a new post.

entry_label_format.description: The format used for showing entry types and titles in the dropdown list.  e.g, "[Draft] My Day at the Beach"

entry_localDraft_label.description: The label that is prepended to drafts that are saved on the user's computer.

entry_draft_label.description: The label that is prepended to drafts that are saved on the user's blog.

entry_scheduled_label.description: The label that is prepended to posts that have been scheduled but not yet published.

action_openBlogInTab.message: Open blog in a new tab

message_blogs_import.message: Let's import your blogs from the previous version of ScribeFire. ScribeFire will populate as many fields as possible; it's up to you to click 'Finish' and then correct any errors.

option_publish_month1.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the first month of the year.

option_publish_month2.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the second month of the year.

option_publish_month3.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the third month of the year.

option_publish_month4.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the fourth month of the year.

option_publish_month5.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the fifth month of the year.

option_publish_month6.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the sixth month of the year.

option_publish_month7.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the seventh month of the year.

option_publish_month8.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the eighth month of the year.

option_publish_month9.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the ninth month of the year.

option_publish_month10.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the tenth month of the year.

option_publish_month11.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the eleventh month of the year.

option_publish_month12.description: A three-letter abbreviation of the twelfth month of the year.

label_help.description: The text that a user clicks on if they need help with ScribeFire.

label_publish.description: The label for the portion of the interface that contains publishing options.

error_header.description: This string is used as the title for any major error that has to be shown. It should relay a sense of 'ScribeFire did something wrong, not you.'

error_post_delete.message:
ScribeFire found this little error when trying to delete your post: $status$

$msg$

error_category_add.message: ScribeFire really wanted to help, but something broke when trying to add a category.  The error code was $error_code$.

error_post_publish.message: ScribeFire couldn't publish your post. Here's the error message that bubbled up: $message$

error_page_publish.message: ScribeFire couldn't publish your page. Here's the error message that bubbled up: $message$

error_api_getBlogs.message: ScribeFire couldn't get the information it needed about your blog. Helpfully, your blog returned this message: $message$

error_api_invalid.message:
It's not your fault, but ScribeFire is looking for an API ($api_type$) that doesn't exist.

If you're an alpha tester, you need to remove this blog and add it again.

error_api_noBlog.message: Slow down... You need to add your blog before you can publish.

error_api_noCategorySupport.message: This blog does not support adding categories.

error_api_noUploadSupport.message: This blog does not support uploading files.

error_api_cannotConnect.message: ScribeFire could not successfully connect to your blog.

error_api_setup.message: While trying to determine your blog's settings, ScribeFire tripped over this code: $code$

error_api_setup_unknownBlogType.message: You're welcome to try and configure your blog manually.

error_api_code412.message: The blog returned a 412 error code. You may be able to fix this by following the instructions at $url$

error_api_noMessage.message: The blog returned a $code$ error code, but no error message could be found.

error_api_blogger_authentication.message: Blogger says that you entered the wrong username or password.

error_api_blogger_verify.message: Blogger says that you need to verify your account's email address; log into your account directly to handle this.

error_api_blogger_tos.message: Blogger says that you still need to agree to Google's Terms of Service; log into your account directly to handle this.

error_api_blogger_deleted.message: Blogger says that the account you're using has been deleted.

error_api_blogger_disabled.message: Blogger says that your access to Blogger has been disabled.

error_api_blogger_unavailable.message: Blogger says that the Blogger service is temporarily unavailable.

error_api_blogger_captcha.message: Google requires that you complete this CAPTCHA in order to continue:

error_api_blogger_unknown.message: Blogger isn't playing nicely; it's giving ScribeFire an error: $error$

error_api_blogger_authToken.message: Could not acquire an authentication token.

error_api_blogger_uploadAPIUnavailable.message: Could not contact the image upload API.

error_api_posterous_noDeleteSupport.message: Posterous does not support post deletion at this time.

error_video_noEmbed.message: ScribeFire could not generate an embed code for this video URL. Please check the URL, or manually paste the embed code in the bottom box.

confirm_deletePost.message: Are you sure you want to delete this post? It will be removed from your blog's server, and it will no longer appear on your blog.

text_inlinks1.message: ScribeFire has partnered with $website$ to provide you with an easy-to-use monetization solution for your blog.

text_inlinks2.message: InLinks are static HTML advertisements located within content areas of websites.  It is simply the most natural paid link on the market.  The benefits for you are:

text_inlinksBenefit1.message: Ads that are easy on the eyes.  No annoying pop-ups!

text_inlinksBenefit2.message: Predictable revenue. Get paid a flat rate/month/ad sold.

text_inlinksBenefit3.message: Blog-friendly. Install our simple plugin and we take care of the rest.  Just sit back and collect your monthly earnings.

text_inlinksBlogs.message: Out of the blogs you have set up in ScribeFire, the following may be compatible with InLinks:

text_inlinksCompatibility.message: (For now, InLinks only works on blogs using Wordpress.org, Drupal, or MovableType.)

text_inlinks3.message: $link_open$ Visit InLinks.com $link_close$ to download the InLinks plugin and start earning money on your blogs today!

text_blogProperties1.message: You can edit the name and URL of your blog here.  To update your username, password, API URL, or blog ID, click the "Remove" button to remove the blog and then re-add it by clicking the "Add a New Blog" button.

text_video1.message: Paste the URL of the video in the box below.

text_video3.message: Or, copy the embed code provided for your video into this box:

confirm_not_saved.message:
Are you sure you want to switch posts? You haven't saved the current version of this post yet.

(Click 'Save Progress' at the bottom of the page to save your progress.)

zemanta_instructions.message: Select the articles you'd like to include in your post:

zemanta_image_instructions.message: Click on an image to add it to your post.

zemanta_tos_description.message: In order to continue, you need to agree to Zemanta's Terms of Service (shown below).

zemanta_tos_accept_request.message: If you agree to the terms, click 'Continue.'

zemanta_tracking_optin.message: Is it ok if ScribeFire adds an invisible image to your post to track Zemanta usage statistics? You won't notice a difference either way, and even if you decline, you won't be asked again.

zemanta_tracking_yes.message: Yes, ScribeFire can add a tracking image to posts when I use Zemanta.

zemanta_tracking_no.message: No, I'd rather not include a tracking image.

zemanta_pixie_reminder.message: Please indicate whether or not ScribeFire can add an invisible image to your posts when you use Zemanta.

zemanta_selection_hint.message: Did you know that you can select text in your post before clicking the Zemanta icon to limit the text that Zemanta uses to find related articles?

zemanta_no_results.message: Zemanta couldn't find any relevant articles for your post.

zemanta_introduction.message: Zemanta helps you create rich blog posts by recognizing your topic and suggesting useful related links. Just write your post, click the Zemanta toolbar icon (screenshot shown below), and then select the articles you'd like to link to.

zemanta_loading_articles_message.message: Please wait while ScribeFire retrieves related articles from Zemanta...

zemanta_loading_images_message.message: Please wait while ScribeFire retrieves related articles from Zemanta...

action_hide.description: Used as the text on a button to hide a portion of the interface.

label_promoted.description: Used to indicate that a link has been sponsored by an advertiser.

adbull_code_instructions.message: Just copy and paste this code into your blog's template, and AdBull will do the rest.

adbull_introduction.message: AdBull provides publishers with a new source of advertiser-driven revenue. AdBull has NO competitors, since it is the exclusive patent-protected provider of contextual cursor advertisements. As a result, AdBull can be incorporated alongside many of the other popular online ad platforms in the market today (from display ads to contextual feeds and beyond).

text_adbull_tos_1.message: I will not click on AdBull ads that are displayed on my website.

text_adbull_tos_2.message: I will not place AdBull ads on sites that include incentives to click on ads.

text_adbull_tos_3.message: I will not place AdBull ads on sites that include pornographic or illegal content.

text_adbull_tos_4.message: I certify that I have read and agree to AdBull's Terms and Conditions.

text_adbull_add_new_site.message: Add a new website to your AdBull account.
